~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Bring your kayaks and bikes (or rent them) to this lovely spot on Southport Island for a weekend of paddling, eating, drinking, biking, & sightseeing with friends old and new. Last year was incredible so be sure to join us again this year!

Arrive Friday, June 8 for two nights at the Ocean Gate Inn on beautiful Southport Island, 2 miles from Boothbay Harbor.  They have a private dock for our kayaks and 45 acres of waterfront grounds.  All rooms are in the newly renovated Waterfront Building with a balcony and two double beds. (In the photo above, it's the white 2-story bldg on the water.)

Waterfront Building - This building features a premium location right on the water, a spectacular ocean view, and private balconies in each room. All rooms have recently been renovated for your enjoyment and the entire property is smoke- and pet-free.

 

 

Reservations: Send a check for the full amount to: Larry Pilla - 21 Baker St. Dover, NH 03820.

Payment is due when you RSVP. I need to send the hotel a deposit to hold the rooms! Your spot is not reserved until I receive your payment.

Price is per person based on double occupancy. If you want a private room, it's no problem. Contact me directly to arrange it.

Your stay includes:

  • 2 nights (Friday-Sunday, June 8-10) shared(or private) accommodation (2 double beds)
  • Full hot buffet breakfast each morning
  • 25” Cable TV with HBO, coffee maker, fridge
  • Private bath, hair dryer, iron/ironing board
  • Outdoor Heated Pool (seasonal)
  • Jacuzzi, Fitness Center
  • Tennis & Basketball Courts, Volleyball, Horseshoe Pits
  • Miniature Golf, Children's Playground, Tetherball
  • Stocked Trout Pond, Games from the Front Desk
  • Picnic and BBQ Area
  • Free local calls / Free daily newspaper

Note: the resort has a limited # of canoes, kayaks, & row boats available free for guest use. However, these are only available for 2 hrs at a time & are not proper sea kayaks. If you want to paddle with us, bring your own or rent from Tidal Transit.

Kayak/Bike Rentals:  Tidal Transit Co., Boothbay Harbor

10% off kayak & bike rentals and FREE delivery to the Inn when you mention Seacoast Outdoors.

If you'd like to join us for dinner on Friday, 6:30 PM @ Robinson's Wharf, please let me know.  I'll make a reservation for as many as respond. There's often an acoustic band w/ guitar, fiddle, & standup bass!

Note: Rooms will be assigned for you when you arrive. Please make check-in as easy as possible for the hotel staff.  If there's a problem, it's okay to switch roommates afterward as long as everyone agrees.

Hiking: The Boothbay Region Land Trust manages over 30 miles of trails in the area that are open for hiking.  On their Website, click on "Guides" to find maps of their preserves.  The Trust also manages several islands that we can paddle to.

Southport Island: Southport is a quiet island below Boothbay Harbor, accessible by a small swing bridge.  There is a great restaurant/pub right on the water,  a quaint general store with an extensive wine collection, and an old town dock at Cape Newagen that looks out over some picturesque islands, a lighthouse, and the sea.

Ocean Gate is located at the protected northern end of Southport Island.  This is the coast of Maine so there are numerous islands and coves to explore, abundant wildlife, and fresh lobster and local oysters to enjoy!

Coastal Kayaking: Dress for the water temperature rather than the air temperature. Maine's waters are still cold in June even if the weather is warm. A wetsuit or drysuit is probably a good idea, and PFDs are required.

Directions to Ocean Gate:

  • I-95 North to exit 44 for I-295 North
  • I-295 North to Exit 31 - onto the Route 1 connecter in Topsham.
  • Follow Route 1 North, passing Brunswick, Bath, & Wiscasset.
  • As you leave the village of Wiscasset, you cross a bridge.
  • About a mile after the bridge, turn right onto Route 27 South.
  • Continue on Rt. 27, making a sharp right at the stop sign next to the library in the village of Boothbay Harbor (just before Boothbay Harbor shops).
  • Continue on Rt. 27 for 2 more miles, crossing Southport Bridge.
  • Continue on Rt. 27 (bearing right) for 3/10 of a mile and you’ll find the entrance to the Ocean Gate Resort on your right.
